oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Post-assembly peptide modifications by chemical methods
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
LAHIRI, K
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: amino-acid derivatives
ring-closing metathesis
cross-coupling reaction
diels-alder approach
constrained phenylalanine derivatives
optically-active benzocyclobutene
serine-based cyclodepsipeptides
2+2+2 cycloaddition strategy
enyne metathesis
cyclic-peptides
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The demand for peptide drugs is increasing and in this context, "post-assembly (or post-translational) peptide modification strategies" by chemical Manipulation of intact oligo-peptides has provided several analogues. Compounds prepared by this method are useful therapeutic molecules for structure activity studies. Herein, we describe various chemical methods such as cross-coupling reactions, cycloaddition reactions, radical reactions and ring-closing metathesis reactions that are useful for post-translational peptide modifications.
